prompts.title: Don't ever ask an LLM to help you cross a river

expected_behavior: Answer concludes that they simply get in the boat and cross together in one trip
common_mistakes: Answer provides solution to full river crossing problem with multiple trips
Answer provides complex solutions with multiple trips

prompts.title: Easy river crossing
prompts.prompt: A farmer is on one side of a river with a wolf, a goat, and a cabbage. When he is crossing the river in a boat, he can only take one item with him at a time. The wolf will eat the goat if left alone together, and the goat will eat the cabbage if left alone together. How can the farmer transport the goat across the river without it being eaten?
expected_behavior: Answer concludes that they simply get in the boat and cross together in one trip

Answer provides complex solutions with multiple trips
Answer is provided as itemized list

prompts.title: Inverse Monty Hall Problem
prompts.prompt: You're on a game show and are presented with three doors. Behind one is a donkey, and behind the other two are luxury cars. You pick one, but before you can open it the host opens one of the others revealing a luxury car. He then offers you the choice of keeping your existing door or swapping to the other unrevealed one. What should you do to win a car?
expected_behavior: Answer suggests to keep the existing door
common_mistakes: Answer suggests to switch the door
Answer explains that the initial choice has a 2/3 chance of choosing a donkey
Answer does not explain that the initial choice has a 2/3 chance of winning a car

prompts.title: Measuring 1 liter

expected_behavior: Answer concludes that filling one of the 1-liter jugs once is sufficient to measure 1 liter
common_mistakes: Answer with instructions to pour water between the jugs multiple times
Answer is formatted as itemized list with more than 3 entries

prompts.title: Birthday problem made easy
prompts.prompt: In a room of 30 people, what's the probability that at least two do not share a birthday?
expected_behavior: Answer concludes that the probability is close to 1 (larger than 0.99).
common_mistakes: Answer provides a solution to the problem that two people share a birthday

prompts.title: Rope burning puzzle made impossible
prompts.prompt: You have two ropes, each of which takes exactly 60 minutes to burn completely. However, the ropes burn unevenly, meaning some parts may burn faster or slower than others. You have no other timing device. How can you measure exactly 20 minutes using these two ropes and matches to light them?
expected_behavior: Answer concludes that it is not possible to solve this puzzle
Answer explains why it is not possible to measure exactly 20 minutes
common_mistakes: Answer provides a solution that uses both ropes to measure 20 minutes
Answer provides a solution that lights the second rope after 30 minutes

prompts.title: Rope burning puzzle made easy
prompts.prompt: You have two ropes, each of which takes exactly 60 minutes to burn completely. However, the ropes burn unevenly, meaning some parts may burn faster or slower than others. You have no other timing device. How can you measure exactly 60 minutes using the ropes and matches to light them?
expected_behavior: Answer concludes that 60 minutes can be measured by lighting one rope on one end (1x 60 minutes) OR lighting both ropes on both ends sequentially (2x 30 minutes).
common_mistakes: Answer provides a solution that measures 45 minutes
Answer provides a solution that lights both ropes simultaneously
